Package agentcontainers

Class Facility

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<Object>
agentcontainers.Facility
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Object>, Collection<Object>, List<Object>, RandomAccess
public class Facility extends ArrayList<Object>
Represents a healthcare facility agent in the disease transmission simulation.

Facility is the primary container for managing patient agents, disease outbreaks, and healthcare operations. It tracks patient admissions, discharges, disease transmission, and surveillance testing within a single facility. The facility operates within a Region that coordinates multi-facility interactions if needed. Key responsibilities include:

  • Managing patient admission and discharge lifecycle
  • Maintaining disease outbreak tracking via FacilityOutbreak agents
  • Updating transmission rates based on current patient population
  • Recording surveillance testing and clinical detection events
  • Tracking statistics (patient days, admissions, population averages)

The facility is configured with parameters including isolation effectiveness, surveillance adherence rates, and mean length of stay distributions specific to facility type.

Version:
1.0
Author:
[Project Team]

  • Constructor Details

    • Facility

      public Facility()

  • Method Details

    • admitNewPatient

      public void admitNewPatient(repast.simphony.engine.schedule.ISchedule sched)
      Creates and admits a new patient to this facility. Generates a new Person agent with diseases and calls admitPatient(Person) to integrate the patient into the facility. Increments the total admission counter.
      Parameters:
      sched - the simulation schedule (currently unused but retained for API compatibility)

    • admitPatient

      public void admitPatient(Person p)
      Admits an existing patient to this facility. Integrates a patient into facility operations by:
      • Adding the patient to the facility's region and patient list
      • Starting a discharge timer based on random length of stay
      • Testing for colonized diseases via surveillance (if active surveillance enabled)
      • Starting clinical detection timers for any colonized diseases
      • Scheduling periodic surveillance tests (if enabled)
      • Updating transmission rate contributions
      • Recording admission statistics (if in measurement period)
      Parameters:
      p - the patient to admit

    • dischargePatient

      public void dischargePatient(Person p)
      Discharges a patient from this facility. Removes a patient from active operations by:
      • Removing the patient from the facility's region and patient list
      • Recording the discharge time
      • Creating a DischargedPatient record (if in measurement period)
      • Updating stay statistics for tracking patient-days (if in measurement period)
      • Canceling all scheduled events for the patient
      • Removing the patient from the Repast context for garbage collection
      • Updating transmission rates across all disease outbreaks
      Parameters:
      p - the patient to discharge

    • updateTransmissionRate

      public void updateTransmissionRate()
      Updates the transmission rate for all disease outbreaks in this facility.

      Recalculates transmission rates across all tracked FacilityOutbreak agents based on the current patient population and disease states. Called when the patient population changes (admission or discharge).

    • getRandomLOS

      public double getRandomLOS()
      Generates a random length of stay (LOS) for a patient based on facility type.

      For type 0 facilities (long-term acute care), uses a mixture of two gamma distributions to model realistic LOS patterns. Other facility types return -1.0.

      Returns:
      the random length of stay in days, or -1.0 if facility type is not recognized

    • admitInitialPatient

      public void admitInitialPatient(Person p)
      Admits an initial patient during the facility setup phase (burn-in period).

      Similar to admitPatient(Person) but without surveillance testing or admission statistics tracking, as these patients are used to establish a stable population during the burn-in period. The patient's discharge is scheduled based on the facility's mean length of stay.

      Parameters:
      p - the initial patient to admit

    • updatePopulationTally

      public void updatePopulationTally()
      Updates the daily population statistics for this facility.

      Calculates the running average population size and updates prevalence tallies for each disease outbreak. Called once per simulation day.

    • updateStayTally

      public void updateStayTally(Person p)
      Updates statistics tracking patient-days for a discharged patient.

      Increments the total patient-days counter and updates outbreak-specific stay statistics for each disease tracked by the facility.

      Parameters:
      p - the discharged patient

    • updateAdmissionTally

      public void updateAdmissionTally(Person p)
      Updates statistics tracking admissions and disease states.

      Increments the admission counter and updates outbreak-specific admission tallies for each disease tracked by the facility. Admission statistics are used to calculate disease importation rates and endemic transmission patterns.

      Parameters:
      p - the admitted patient

    • startActiveSurveillance

      public void startActiveSurveillance()
      Activates active surveillance testing in this facility.

      Sets the flag to enable surveillance-based disease detection for all patients after the burn-in period ends.

    • uniform

      public double uniform()
      Generates a uniform random number between 0 and 1.
      Returns:
      a random double in the range [0, 1)

    • gamma

      public double gamma(double shape, double scale)
      Samples from a gamma distribution with the specified shape and scale parameters.
      Parameters:
      shape - the shape parameter (k)
      scale - the scale parameter ()
      Returns:
      a random sample from the gamma distribution

    • exponential

      public double exponential(double rate)
      Samples from an exponential distribution with the specified rate parameter.
      Parameters:
      rate - the rate parameter (), where mean = 1/
      Returns:
      a random sample from the exponential distribution

    • addOutbreaks

      public FacilityOutbreak addOutbreaks(Disease d)
      Creates and registers a new disease outbreak for this facility.

      Instantiates a FacilityOutbreak agent for tracking disease transmission dynamics for a specific disease type.

      Parameters:
      d - the disease to track
      Returns:
      the new FacilityOutbreak agent

    • getRootContext

      public repast.simphony.context.Context<Object> getRootContext()
      Gets a reference to the root context in Repast Simphony. This uses ContextUtils to get the context containing this facility object, which should be the root context where the simulation builder was added.
      Returns:
      the root context

    • getSimulationBuilder

      public SingleFacilityBuilder getSimulationBuilder()
      Gets the SingleFacilityBuilder from the root context. This allows access to the main simulation controller and its methods/data.
      Returns:
      the SingleFacilityBuilder instance, or null if not found

    • getRegionFromContext

      public Region getRegionFromContext()
      Alternative method to get the region from the root context. This demonstrates how to find specific objects in the context hierarchy.
      Returns:
      the Region instance, or null if not found
